name: Hydrogen
main_purpose: Fuel for rockets, production of ammonia and hydrogenation
fun_fact: Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe.

name: Helium
main_purpose: Used in balloons, cooling, and as a cryogenic agent
fun_fact: Helium is the second lightest and second most abundant element in the universe.

name: Lithium
main_purpose: Batteries, ceramics, and treatment for bipolar disorder
fun_fact: Lithium is the lightest metal and has the highest electrochemical potential.

name: Beryllium
main_purpose: Used in aerospace, nuclear reactors, and X-ray windows
fun_fact: Beryllium is an element that exhibits both metallic and nonmetallic properties.

name: Boron
main_purpose: Used in glassmaking, semiconductors, and flame retardants
fun_fact: Boron is an essential micronutrient for plants and plays a role in cell wall structure.

name: Carbon
main_purpose: Building blocks of life, fuels, and materials like diamonds
fun_fact: Carbon is the element that forms the basis of organic chemistry and is present in all living things.

name: Nitrogen
main_purpose: Used in fertilizers, food preservation, and air conditioning
fun_fact: Nitrogen gas makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere and is crucial for life on Earth.

name: Oxygen
main_purpose: Supports respiration, fuels combustion, and used in medical therapies
fun_fact: Oxygen is the third most abundant element in the universe and is essential for sustaining life.

name: Fluorine
main_purpose: Used in toothpaste, nonstick coatings, and as a refrigerant
fun_fact: Fluorine is the most electronegative and reactive element on the periodic table.

name: Neon
main_purpose: Used in neon signs, lighting, and cryogenic refrigeration
fun_fact: Neon is known for its distinct bright orange-red glow when used in illuminated signs.
